perturbation.changed_text:
1.3      "Affiliate" means, with respect to any Person, any Person which,          directly or indirectly, controls, is controlled by, or is under common          control with, the specified Person. For purposes of this definition,          the term "control" as applied to any Person, means the possession,          directly or indirectly, of at least fifty-one per cent (51%) of the          power to direct or cause the direction of the management of that          Person, whether&sbsp;through ownership of voting securities or otherwise.

For the purposes of Article VIII (Assignability) only, "control" means ownership of greater than 25% of voting securities.
perturbation.explanation: The definition of 'control' is changed in the context of assignability. One section uses 51% ownership of voting securities as the criterion for control while another part of the contract uses 25%. This contradiction creates uncertainty when determining if a party can assign the contract due to an affiliate's control.

In the event that a Party is asked to disclose any          confidential information to a Governmental or Regulatory Authority,          such Party will - if possible - notify the nondisclosing Party          sufficiently prior to making such disclosure so as to allow the          nondisclosing Party adequate time to take whatever action it may deem          to be appropriate to protect the confidentiality of the information.          The obligation not to disclose Technical Information and GALEN          Information shall not apply to (a) any information that it now or later          becomes publicly available through no fault of the receiver, its          officers, employees or agents; (b) any information that the receiver          obtains from a third party not under a confidentiality obligation to          the discloser with respect to such information; (c) any information          that the receiver already has in its possession as indicated in its          written records; and (d) any information that is independently          developed or created by the receiver.

perturbation.changed_text:
7.3      In the event that one of the Parties hereto materially defaults or          breaches any of the provisions of this Agreement, the other Party shall          have the right to terminate this Agreement upon sixty (60) days'          written notice, provided, however, that if the Party in default, within          the sixty day period referred to, remedies the said default or breach,          the Agreement shall continue in full force and effect.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, a material breach by GALEN of Section VI (Compliance with Laws) shall result in immediate termination by LEO, without any opportunity to cure.
perturbation.explanation: Section 7.3 provides a 60-day cure period for material breaches. The added clause removes the cure period for GALEN's breaches of Section VI, creating a contradiction. One section allows for a cure, while the other prohibits it for a specific scenario.
